p: As shown above, there is a large number of medicinal mushrooms in diverse taxonomic groups. Some of these medicinal mushrooms are commercially cultivated for food but there is an increasing trend for developing the immune-active compounds from these cultivated mushrooms into nutraceuticals. Table 2, Table 3, Table 4 and Table 5 summarize the major groups of bioactive compounds in medicinal mushrooms and their demonstrated immunomodulatory effects to specific pathologies, including the relevant references.
